wikitext.*:
[[File:T.P. Dunning 1963.jpg|thumb|350px]]
In [[1963]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to [[T.P. Dunning|T.P. ("Tom") Dunning]]''', Tolkien's former student.<ref>{{CG|C}}, p. 772</ref><ref name=Bloom>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.bloomsburyauctions.com/detail/36055/391.0|articlename=Lot 391, Important Books, Manuscripts & Works on Paper: The 30th Anniversary Sale, 30 May 2013|dated=|website=[http://www.bloomsburyauctions.com/ Bloomsbury Auctions]|accessed=11 May 2013}}</ref>

*'''Description:''' Handwritten letter, one page, loosely inserted in Dunning's copy of ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]'', signed by Tolkien.<ref name=Bloom/>
*The letter and book sold for £3,500 (£4,340 including feeds fees) at Bloomsbury on 30 May 2013.

==From the auction==

{{Quote|In the letter Tolkien apologises 'that [[Farmer Giles of Ham|this]] is only half a book. Even so it cost me great pains.' He goes on to mention his health 'Am going away on Friday next by Doctor's orders to ''me'' not to [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]], though she is pretty groggy. I am now nearly out of juice: mental, or physical.'|Bloomsbury Auctions<ref name=Bloom/>}}
